CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In contrast , as evidenced in the results of the DFT calculations for (BDTT-DPP)-(BDTT-TPD)-(BDTT-DPP) , the electron distribution in the HOMO and LUMO wave functions is similar to those of ( BDTT - DPP ) 3 and ( BDTT - TPD ) 3 ( Figures 5a,b ).

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| (BDTT-DPP) |
| (BDTT-TPD) |
| (BDTT-DPP) 3 |
| (BDTT-TPD) 3 |
| (BDTT-DPP)-(BDTT-TPD)-(BDTT-DPP) |

Note that I have included the entities as they are presented in the original paragraph, including any special characters or formatting.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph again, I realize that there is only one clear material name mentioned, which is "BDTT-DPP" and its variations. Here are the valid entities in a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| BDTT-DPP |
| BDTT-TPD |
| BDTT-DPP 3 |
| BDTT-TPD 3 |
| (BDTT-DPP)-(BDTT-TPD)-(BDTT-DPP) |

Note that I have included "BDTT-TPD" as a valid material name because it is mentioned in the paragraph as a separate material from BDTT-DPP, even though it is not explicitly labeled as a material name.
